item.title: Cheating Permitted? German Federal Court of Justice Rules on ‚ÄòAction Replay II‚Äô
item.description: In a landmark decision with significant implications for both the video game industry and copyright law, the German Federal Court of Justice (Bundesgerichtshof or BGH) has issued a ruling on the legality of ‚Äúcheat software.‚Äù The case, known as ‚ÄúAction Replay II,‚Äù has established a key distinction between modifying a game‚Äôs underlying code and simply manipulating its in-game data...

item.title: The EU Cyber Resilience Act: Raising the Bar for Digital Product Security
item.description: The Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) entered into force on 10 December 2024, establishing mandatory cybersecurity requirements for all products with digital elements sold in the EU market. While the Act is now law, main obligations apply from 11 December 2027, with some requirements (like incident reporting) taking effect from 11 September 2026...

item.title: darkmailr ‚Äî Generate realistic, context-aware phishing emails ‚Äî air-gapped
item.description: darkmailr is a self-hosted, offline phishing simulation tool that uses open-source LLMs (via Ollama) to generate realistic, context-aware phishing emails for red team exercises, security awareness training, and prompt injection testing...

item.title: Red Team Adaptation in the Age of Agentic AI ‚Äî A Game Theory Playbook for Offensive Security
item.description: The game has changed. As a red teamer, you've mastered the art of thinking like your adversaries, exploiting human psychology, and finding the unexpected path through seemingly impenetrable defenses. But now you're facing something entirely different: agentic AI systems that don't get tired, don't make emotional decisions, and can process information at speeds that make your fastest reconnaissance look glacial...

item.title: Cleartext Protocols 101: How to Connect Anonymously to FTP, Telnet, and rsync
item.description: Welcome back to the "100s Series"! After mastering network reconnaissance with tcpdump, Wireshark, and Nmap, it's time to explore what happens when you find open services. While modern security practices emphasize encryption and authentication, legacy cleartext protocols still lurk in corporate networks, IoT devices, and forgotten systems. File Transport Protocol (FTP), Telnet, and rsync often expose sensitive data through misconfigured anonymous access, default credentials, and unprotected file shares. This article will teach you to identify, access, and extract intelligence from such cleartext protocol implementations...

item.title: Your Client‚Äôs Data Is Not Safe with Microsoft ‚Äî And You Know It
item.description: EU lawyers are bound not only by the law, but by strict professional duties of confidentiality. Continuing to use the Microsoft ecosystem ‚Äî which is subject to U.S. surveillance laws and known for opaque data handling practices ‚Äî may violate core tenets of GDPR, EU Court rulings, and professional codes. The legal profession must move toward self-hosted, open-source, and EU-based services to protect client data and uphold the integrity of their work...
